intro: Hieracium lamprophyllum subsp. cezycola, commonly known as the silverleaf hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant features silver-white hairs on its leaves and stems, giving it a distinctive appearance. It typically grows in moist meadows and along stream banks, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late summer, contributing to its ecological role in supporting pollinators.
